intro: Euplassa isernii, commonly known as the Isern's euplassa, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. Its unique morphology and restricted habitat make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Euplassa isernii is considered vulnerable and requires protection.
